citations.narrative:
An enclosure is not being maintained in good repair. There is a tear in the paneling at the bottom left corner of a doggy-
door on the exterior wall of a sheltered housing facility containing 6 adult dogs. The tear in the paneling is approximately
10-inches in length with sharp edges that are pulled away from the underlying wall. Sharp edges may cause injury to the
dogs that come into contact with it. Correct by ensuring housing structures are free of jagged edges or sharp points by
maintaining surfaces so that they can be repaired when worn or damaged. Correct by: June 15, 2024.

The facility is not keeping a current medical record of heartworm testing dates and results. The last record is from
11/16/22. The Attending Veterinarian (AV) reports that the heartworm tests were done when blood draws were performed
for other testing within the last year. Maintaining medical records allows APHIS officials the ability to verify that the facility
is following their Program of Vet Care, as well as ensuring the dogs at the facility are receiving adequate veterinary care.
Correct by ensuring the facility keep copies of medical records and make the records available during APHIS inspections.
These records must include the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other recommended or required test
or examination. Correct by: June 6, 2024, onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
